name: Stanford University
admission_dates: Fall: September 1 - December 1, Spring: Not specified
events_facilities: Stanford has state-of-the-art venues for hosting events, including the Stanford Stadium and Arrillaga Center for Sports and Recreation.
sports_facilities: The university offers top-notch sports facilities, such as the Avery Aquatic Center, Maples Pavilion, and the Stanford Golf Course.
research_history: Stanford is renowned for its contributions to various fields of research, including computer science, medicine, engineering, and more.
admission_process: Prospective students must submit their applications online and provide required documents, such as transcripts, test scores, and letters of recommendation.
event_details: Orientation Week takes place at the beginning of each academic year to welcome new students and introduce them to campus life.
research_works: Development of the Stanford Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)
sports_categories: Stanford University offers a variety of NCAA Division I sports.

name: Johns Hopkins University
admission_dates: Fall: September 1 - January 4, Spring: Not specified
events_facilities: Johns Hopkins offers various event facilities, including the Ralph S. O'Connor Recreation Center and the Shriver Hall Auditorium.
sports_facilities: The university provides excellent sports facilities, such as the Cordish Lacrosse Center, Goldfarb Gymnasium, and Homewood Field.
research_history: Johns Hopkins has a rich history of groundbreaking research, particularly in the fields of medicine, public health, and engineering.
admission_process: Prospective students can apply through the Common Application or the Coalition Application and should submit required documents.
event_details: Hopkins on the Hill is an annual event where students showcase their research projects to policymakers in Washington, D.C.
research_works: Development of the Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR)
sports_categories: Johns Hopkins University participates in various Division III sports.

name: Harvard University
admission_dates: Fall: October 1 - January 1, Spring: Not specified
events_facilities: Harvard hosts events in prestigious locations like Harvard Stadium and Sanders Theatre.
sports_facilities: Harvard's sports facilities include the Malkin Athletic Center, Bright-Landry Hockey Center, and Harvard Boathouse.
research_history: Harvard is a leading institution with a long history of impactful research across various disciplines, including law, business, and social sciences.
admission_process: Prospective students can apply through the Common Application, the Coalition Application, or Universal College Application.
event_details: The Harvard-Yale Game is an annual football game between the two rival Ivy League universities.
research_works: Harvard researchers have made significant contributions to various fields, winning Nobel Prizes and other prestigious awards.
sports_categories: Harvard University has a strong NCAA Division I athletic program.

name: University of Georgia
admission_dates: Fall: October 15 - January 1, Spring: August 1 - November 15
events_facilities: The University of Georgia organizes events in venues like Sanford Stadium and Tate Student Center.
sports_facilities: UGA's sports facilities include the William Porter Payne and Porter Otis Payne Indoor Athletic Facility, Stegeman Coliseum, and Foley Field.
research_history: The University of Georgia has a strong research emphasis, particularly in agricultural sciences, ecology, and veterinary medicine.
admission_process: Prospective students should submit their applications through the University of Georgia's admissions website.
event_details: G-Day is the annual spring football game where fans get a glimpse of the team's performance before the season.
research_works: UGA researchers have made significant contributions to agriculture and environmental sciences.
sports_categories: The University of Georgia competes in various NCAA Division I sports.

name: University of Florida
admission_dates: Fall: August 1 - November 1, Spring: Not specified
events_facilities: The University of Florida organizes events in venues like Ben Hill Griffin Stadium and the Stephen C. O'Connell Center.
sports_facilities: UF's sports facilities include the James G. Pressly Stadium, Katie Seashole Pressly Stadium, and the Alfred A. McKethan Stadium.
research_history: The University of Florida is known for its research in areas such as agricultural sciences, engineering, and space exploration.
admission_process: Prospective students should apply through the University of Florida's admissions portal and submit the required documents.
event_details: Gator Growl is the largest student-run pep rally in the world, held during Homecoming week.
research_works: The University of Florida has contributed significantly to advancements in space technology and health sciences.
sports_categories: The University of Florida is part of the NCAA Division I athletic program.

name: University of Miami
admission_dates: Fall: September 1 - January 15, Spring: Not specified
events_facilities: The University of Miami hosts events in venues like Watsco Center and Donna E. Shalala Student Center.
sports_facilities: UM's sports facilities include Cobb Stadium, Mark Light Field at Alex Rodriguez Park, and the Neil Schiff Tennis Center.
research_history: The University of Miami is involved in extensive research, particularly in the fields of marine sciences, medicine, and music.
admission_process: Prospective students can apply through the Common Application, Coalition Application, or the University of Miami's application.
event_details: CaneFest is an annual music festival and carnival held on the university's campus.
research_works: The University of Miami has a strong focus on marine and environmental research, as well as medical advancements.
sports_categories: The University of Miami competes in various NCAA Division I sports.
